title: Sienna Miller shows off her flair for fashion in 70s inspired dress
text:
She never fails to put a foot wrong when it comes to her sartorial choices.

And Sienna Miller was putting on yet another stylish display on Wednesday when she attended a special screening of her film American Woman in London.

The actress, 37, donned a 70s inspired look for her outing, wearing an asymmetrical brown dress teamed with a pair of electric blue boots.

Super chic: Sienna Miller was putting on yet another stylish display on Wednesday when she attended a special screening of her film American Woman in London

Sienna dared to be different in her beige frock, which boasted chocolate coloured stripes and a matching collar.

The striking blonde added a pop of colour to her outfit thanks to her statement suede boots.

She wore her hair down in perfectly coiffed waves and enhanced her pretty features with heavy bronzer and dark kohl.

Striking: The actress, 37, donned a 70s inspired look for her outing, wearing an asymmetrical brown dress teamed with a pair of electric blue boots

Feeling blue: The striking blonde added a pop of colour to her outfit thanks to her statement suede boots

Sienna's outing comes after the beauty called out 'liberal fascism' in dictating that only certain actors can play minority ethnic and gay roles, insisting 'everybody should be able to play everybody'.

During an interview the American-British actor, 37, opened up about her opinions on the film industry, criticising the 'whitewashing' of roles.

She weighed in on the debate about which roles actors should be able to play in terms of ethnic minority, gay and transgender characters.

Gorgeous: She wore her hair down in perfectly coiffed waves and enhanced her pretty features with heavy bronzer and dark kohl

Chic: Sienna dared to be different in her beige frock, which boasted chocolate coloured stripes and a matching collar

Rock and roll: Sienna rubbed shoulders with Oasis rocker Noel Gallagher

Catching-up: The actress also posed for a photo with boyfriend Lucas Zwirner

Sartorially-savvy: Mary Charteris cut a stylish figure in a button coat and suede brown boots

Royalty: Princess Eugenie of York (right) joined the girls for a snap

Regal: Princess Eugenie also posed for a photo with Gala Gordon

Rubbing shoulders: The royal also mingled with Sienna's boyfriend Lucas

Quirky: Jess Morris showcased her kooky style as she also attended the American Woman screening

Miller told The Telegraph: 'It feels like liberal is becoming almost fascistic in its controlling of what can and cannot be done. It feels dangerous to me.'

She added that we should be able to make our own decisions about what we want to see and that it starts to feel 'complicated' when you start to legislate on what roles you can and cannot play.

In the interview she also opened up about how the MeToo movement has 'intersected unhappily with her own life'.

Miller revealed she used to call Harvey Weinstein 'Pops' and said 'on some level' she did this to deflect her suspicions about him.
description: Sienna Miller was putting on yet another stylish display on Wednesday when she attended a special screening of her film American Woman in London.
